senses.sense_definition: A room, set of rooms, or building used for non-manual work, administration, or business.

examples.text: He drives to the <w>office</w> every morning at eight o'clock.
Our main <w>office</w> is located in the center of the city.
She went to the post <w>office</w> to send a package.

senses.sense_definition: The people who work in a particular place of business, considered as a group.

examples.text: The whole <w>office</w> went out for lunch to celebrate her birthday.
He is the most experienced person in our <w>office</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A place where a doctor or dentist sees patients for consultation and treatment.

examples.text: I have an appointment at the doctor's <w>office</w> this afternoon.
The nurse called me back into the <w>office</w> for my exam.

senses.sense_definition: A collection of computer programs for business tasks, typically including word processing and spreadsheets.

examples.text: You need to install the new <w>office</w> suite on your laptop.
Most companies use standard <w>office</w> software for their daily tasks.

senses.sense_definition: An official position of authority and responsibility, especially in a government or organization.

examples.text: She decided to run for <w>office</w> in the upcoming local election.
The mayor has been in <w>office</w> for over three years.
He took <w>office</w> immediately after the ceremony.

senses.sense_definition: A major administrative department of a government.

examples.text: The Foreign <w>Office</w> issued a statement regarding the international crisis.
He works for the patent <w>office</w> reviewing new inventions.

senses.sense_definition: Help or influence exerted on behalf of someone else, usually in the phrase 'good offices'.

examples.text: The dispute was settled through the good <w>offices</w> of a mediator.
We hope to resolve this matter with your kind <w>offices</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A religious service or set of prayers recited daily by clergy.

examples.text: The monks gathered in the chapel to sing the evening <w>office</w>.
Priests are required to recite the Divine <w>Office</w> every day.

senses.sense_definition: To provide someone with office space.

examples.text: The new employees were <w>officed</w> in the temporary building.
The department is currently <w>officed</w> on the second floor.
